meanings.definition: Of or relating to the bone marrow
meanings.sent1: The doctor explained that the myeloid cells are important for bone health.
meanings.sent2: Her myeloid condition required regular check-ups at the hospital.
meanings.sent3: The myeloid soup recipe was a hit at the family dinner.
meanings.sent4: His dedication to his work was as strong as myeloid support for bones.
meanings.sent5: The myeloid connection between bone health and blood production is fascinating.

meanings.definition: Resembling or derived from bone marrow
meanings.sent1: The myeloid tissue sample showed characteristics similar to bone marrow.
meanings.sent2: The patient's symptoms were indicative of a myeloid origin.
meanings.sent3: The myeloid-colored paint gave the room a cozy feel.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as warm and comforting as a myeloid embrace.
meanings.sent5: The myeloid scent of the flowers reminded her of the hospital.
